intro: Petalostemon violaceus var. tenuis, commonly known as the slender violet petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
